definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Alcohol consumption is linked to both higher homicide rates and more vehicle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 酒精消耗和殺人案件及交通事故增多都有聯繫。

sentences.english: The number of explosions and arbitrary killings has declined in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾周以來，爆炸案和任意殺人案件正在逐步減少。

sentences.english: This case is typically a cold-blooded murder.
sentences.chinese: 該案是一個典型的預謀殺人案。

sentences.english: Interlink homicides happen in the quite highway, you are the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 寂靜的公路發生了連環殺人案件，兇手就是你。

sentences.english: I didn't hear about the recent case of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有聽說最近的殺人案件。

sentences.english: What do they want to do to make such a clear stabbing case so complicated?
sentences.chinese: 這種明白的殺人案，怎麼這麼複雜？

sentences.english: The police station granted a reward to the informer of the extraordinary murder case.
sentences.chinese: 公安局獎勵了那起特大殺人案的出首者。

sentences.english: You know how many orgies I had as a homicide cop , Gordon?
sentences.chinese: 你知道殺人案有多少明顯的證據嗎？

sentences.english: Anti-detection acts are representative in the series of robbery and murder cases.
sentences.chinese: 系列謀財殺人案件中的反偵查行爲很具有代表性。

sentences.english: An investigation into the killings is under way, Xinhua said.
sentences.chinese: 新華社說，這個殺人案件正在進行調查。

definition: to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
